metadata.name: Create Auto-Updating Research Stack in Dropbox Dash
metadata.description: Create a Stack (smart collection) in Dropbox Dash that automatically monitors and aggregates research papers, articles, and internal documents on specific topics
metadata.context: Research Monitoring with Dropbox Dash Stacks
prerequisites: Dropbox Dash account with connected applications
Relevant apps connected (arXiv, Google Drive, Notion, Slack, etc.)
Clear research topic or monitoring area defined

outputs: Stack created with defined search criteria
Stack automatically updates as new content matches criteria
Centralized view of research on specific topic
Time saved on manual research monitoring (2-4 hours/week)

steps.description: Clearly define what topic you want to monitor (e.g., 'retrieval augmented generation', 'product-led growth strategies', 'customer churn analysis'). Determine scope (timeframe, sources, depth)
steps.output: Clear topic definition and monitoring criteria
tips: Be specific enough to avoid noise (not just 'AI')
Broad enough to capture variants ('RAG' vs 'retrieval augmented generation')

steps.description: Craft search query that captures your research topic. Use natural language and include key terms, synonyms, and context. Test query first to verify it finds relevant content
steps.output: Tested search query that returns relevant results
examples: arXiv papers on vision transformers published after 2023
internal docs and Slack threads about customer retention strategies
competitor analysis reports mentioning AI features
research on multi-modal LLM evaluation methods

steps.description: Run your search query in Dropbox Dash to verify it returns the type of content you want to monitor. Review first 10-20 results for relevance
steps.success_criteria: At least 70% of top 20 results are relevant to research topic

steps.description: Click 'Save as Stack' or 'Create Stack' button in Dash search results. Give your Stack a descriptive name (e.g., 'RAG Research - arXiv + Internal', 'Customer Churn Analysis')
steps.output: Stack created with initial search criteria

steps.description: Set Stack update frequency (real-time, daily, weekly), notification preferences, and source filters if needed
options: Update frequency: Real-time, Daily digest, Weekly digest
Source filters: All apps, specific apps only
Date range: Last week, last month, all time, custom

steps.description: Pin Stack to your Dash homepage or add to relevant workspace for easy access. Organize with other related Stacks if applicable
After 1 week, review new items added to Stack. Assess signal-to-noise ratio. Refine search query if too many irrelevant results or missing key content
steps.success_criteria: 70%+ of new items are relevant; no major content gaps identified

steps.description: Set up recurring calendar reminder to review Stack (daily for high-priority topics, weekly for general monitoring). Spend 10-20 minutes scanning new additions

quality_checklist: Stack name is descriptive and includes topic + sources/timeframe
Stack automatically updates with new matching content
Stack is easily accessible from Dash dashboard
Initial week review completed with refinements
Signal-to-noise ratio acceptable (not overwhelming, not missing key content)

topic_selection: Choose topics you'll revisit weekly/monthly (not one-off searches)
Balance specificity (avoid noise) with coverage (don't miss variants)
Consider creating separate Stacks for different aspects (e.g., 'RAG - Academic Papers' vs 'RAG - Industry Implementations')
query_optimization: Use boolean operators if supported (AND, OR, NOT)
Test with multiple phrasings (technical jargon vs. plain language)
Combine topic keywords with source-specific terms (e.g., 'arXiv:' prefix if supported)
Iterate based on week 1 results (add exclusions for common false positives)
organization: Group related Stacks in workspaces (e.g., 'AI Research', 'Competitive Intel')
Use consistent naming conventions across Stacks
Archive Stacks when topic is no longer relevant (don't delete - future reference)
Tag Stacks by project, theme, or priority level if Dash supports
Link Stacks in documentation (e.g., project wiki references relevant Stack)

example_stack_configurations.query: retrieval augmented generation OR RAG OR retrieval-augmented
example_stack_configurations.sources: arXiv, Google Drive (internal research folder), Slack #ai-research channel
example_stack_configurations.use_case: Stay current with RAG research for product feature development

example_stack_configurations.query: customer churn OR retention strategies OR reduce churn
example_stack_configurations.sources: Google Docs, Notion, Slack, saved articles
example_stack_configurations.use_case: Ongoing monitoring for product retention initiatives
Competitive intelligence for product roadmap planning

time_savings_analysis.without_stack: Manual research monitoring: 2-4 hours/week (visiting multiple sources, searching, aggregating)
time_savings_analysis.quality_improvement: 90% less chance of missing important research (automated vs. manual)

related_task_templates: Task-Template-062: Conduct Universal Search Across Work Apps
Task-Template-065: Prepare Meeting Context with Dash Search
Task-Template-066: Setup Daily AI/ML Research Monitoring
related_entities.discovery_source: Video_016.md - Dropbox Dash Interview with Morgan Brown

common_monitoring_topics: AI/ML research areas (RAG, vision transformers, LLM evaluation, etc.)
Industry trends (product-led growth, AI adoption, remote work tools)
Customer feedback themes (feature requests, pain points, use cases)
Internal knowledge (project updates, team learnings, best practices)
Regulatory and compliance (GDPR updates, AI regulations, data privacy)
Technology stack and tools (new frameworks, libraries, platforms)

integration_opportunities.arxiv_integration: Connect arXiv to monitor daily submissions in specific categories (cs.AI, cs.LG, etc.)
integration_opportunities.slack_integration: Monitor specific channels (#research, #product, #competitive-intel) for relevant discussions
integration_opportunities.notion_integration: Aggregate research notes, summaries, and team wikis
integration_opportunities.google_drive_integration: Track internal research repos, shared folders, and collaborative docs
integration_opportunities.web_articles: Save articles from RSS feeds, newsletters, or browser extensions to Dash

troubleshooting.too_many_irrelevant_results: Narrow query with exclusions (NOT keyword), add specific source filters, refine timeframe
troubleshooting.missing_key_content: Broaden query with synonyms/variants, check source app connections, verify content has appropriate metadata
troubleshooting.stack_not_updating: Check update frequency settings, verify source app sync is working, refresh Dash cache
troubleshooting.overwhelming_volume: Add filters (date range, file type, specific sources), increase review cadence, create sub-Stacks by subtopic

version_history.changes: Initial template creation from Video_016.md workflow extraction
